Well, there's none or only a tiny amount of energy equivalent to the initial matter. All the stars you see run on debt, the debt is paid for by gravity in an expanding universe. There's literally nothing if everything would be packed together.  One more discovery that's quite recent, is that the initial conditions to forming a universe may be present inside a black hole. When a new universe is formed, it will pinch off from this one and live a separate life, unconnected to ours.
